source:
rory mcilroy believes it is ` unthinkable ' that he will not win the masters at some point to complete the career grand slam .
and the world number one has revealed how his final-round collapse at augusta national in 2011 was the most important day of his career .
mcilroy is looking to claim his first green jacket and become just the sixth player to win all four major titles after gene sarazen , ben hogan , gary player , jack nicklaus and tiger woods .
rory mcilroy tees off at the arnold palmer invitational golf tournament in orlando on march 19
` for me now it 's a career-long goal to win there to achieve something that only a handful of players have ever achieved , ' the 25-year-old said in an interview with bbc northern ireland .
` there 's something special i can achieve going into augusta this year .
you are a complete player if you can win every major because they are on different golf courses , different tests , different conditions .
not many guys have done it in history so to put my name there would be awesome .
it would just be incredible .
` you feel the sense of what can be achieved but i ca n't think about that too much .
i just have to think about trying to go out there and playing as best as i can and if i can do that hopefully my scores add up to a shot lower than anyone else 's . '
mcilroy has just one top-10 finish to his name in six masters appearances , finishing joint eighth last year despite the embarrassment of being outscored by his marker in the third round .
mcilroy is hoping to complete his grand slam of majors with a victory at augusta later this month
but the 25-year-old can not picture going through his career without slipping on at least one coveted green jacket .
` during my career , yes it 's unthinkable , ' he added .
` if i do n't win it this year ... either it 's not the right time or it is n't your time .
if i was to look back as a 60-year-old on my career and not have won a green jacket i 'd obviously be very , very disappointed .
` and not just one .
i feel like it 's a course i can do very well at and a golf course i can hopefully win multiple times on .
obviously getting that first one is extra important and from there we can go on and maybe think about getting some others . '
mcilroy held a four-shot lead going into the final round four years ago , only to collapse to a closing 80 and finish 10 shots behind the winner charl schwartzel .
but he bounced back to win his first major title by eight shots in the us open two months later , before adding wins in the 2012 us pga and both the open and us pga last year .
mcilroy is hoping to emulate the likes of jack nicklaus ( above ) by winning all four major titles
` i think it was the most important day of my career , ' he added .
` if i had n't had the whole unravelling and say i just made a couple of bogeys coming down the stretch and lost by one , i might not have learnt as much .
` but for it all to come apart how it did i learnt an awful lot .
i learnt so much about myself and my game and what i needed to do differently the next time i was in that position .
` luckily it did n't take me long to get into a position like that again where i was leading a major and we know how that one played out .
i was able to get over the line pretty comfortably . '
mcilroy 's extraordinary success last year came despite the distractions of calling off his wedding to caroline wozniacki and a legal dispute with his former management company which cost him millions of pounds when it was finally settled in february .
mcilroy 's extraordinary success last year came he called off his wedding to caroline wozniacki
and he hopes he can again use the golf course as his ` sanctuary ' from the pressure and hype surrounding augusta .
` the golf course was my sanctuary , it was where i could get away from everything and just not have to think about it for the four or five hours that i am out there and it helped .
it really did , ' he added .
` i was looking forward to getting to the course and playing and practising and i think it will be the same at augusta because there will be so much hype and build up and talk about what could happen .
` i know i wo n't be able to wait until thursday morning or afternoon and just get on the golf course and play golf .
there is only so much you can talk about it and then you have to go out and try and play . '
summary: ory McIlroy, the world number one golfer, aims to win the Masters to complete the career grand slam, joining an elite group of six players who have achieved this feat. He considers winning the Masters as a career-long goal and believes it is "unthinkable" not to win it at some point. McIlroy has had one top-10 finish in six Masters appearances, but he is hoping to win his first green jacket this year. He has previously experienced a collapse in the final round of the Masters in 2011, which he considers the most important day of his career as it taught him valuable lessons about himself and his game. McIlroy is set to tee off at the Arnold Palmer Invitational Golf Tournament on March 19. Despite the distractions of calling off his wedding and a legal dispute, McIlroy had an extraordinary successful year in 2014, winning multiple majors. He hopes to use the golf course as his "sanctuary" from the pressure and hype surrounding the Masters.

summary: ory McIlroy believes it is unthinkable that he will not win the Masters at some point to complete the career grand slam. He is looking to claim his first green jacket and become the sixth player to win all four major titles. McIlroy has one top-10 finish in six Masters appearances and hopes to complete his grand slam with a victory at Augusta later this month. He views Augusta as a sanctuary from the pressure and hype surrounding the tournament. McIlroy experienced a significant collapse at the Augusta National in 2011, but he has since bounced back to win multiple major titles. Despite the distractions of his personal life, McIlroy remains focused on achieving his career goals.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the core information in the passage:

Rory McIlroy, the world's top-ranked golfer, is aiming to win the Masters tournament to complete a career grand slam. He believes it's "unthinkable" that he won't win it at some point in his career. McIlroy sees his 2011 final-round collapse at Augusta as the most important day of his career, as it taught him valuable lessons. He would join an elite group of only five other golfers who have won all four major titles if he succeeds. Despite the pressure and hype surrounding the tournament, McIlroy views the golf course as his "sanctuary" where he can focus solely on his game. He's eager to start playing and hopes to win multiple green jackets in his career.

summary: Rory McIlroy, the world number one golfer, is confident he will win the Masters to complete the career grand slam. Despite a history of collapses at Augusta, he views the 2011 final-round collapse as a pivotal learning experience. McIlroy aims to join an elite group of players who have won all four major titles. He believes his ability to win on various courses makes him a complete player. The 25-year-old is determined to win multiple green jackets, seeing Augusta as a course where he can excel. McIlroy's resilience and growth after setbacks are highlighted, along with his ability to use golf as a sanctuary from off-course distractions.

summary: Rory McIlroy, the world number one golfer, believes it is "unthinkable" that he will not win the Masters to complete the career grand slam. He views his 2011 final-round collapse at Augusta National as the most important day of his career, as it taught him valuable lessons. McIlroy aims to become the sixth player to win all four major titles, following in the footsteps of Gene Sarazen, Ben Hogan, Gary Player, Jack Nicklaus, and Tiger Woods. Despite having only one top-10 finish in six Masters appearances, McIlroy remains determined to win the green jacket. He sees Augusta National as a course where he can potentially win multiple times, making the Masters his primary career goal.

mcilroy held a four-shot lead going into the final round four years ago , only to collapse to a closing 80 and finish 10 shots behind the winner charl schwartzel .
but he bounced back to win his first major title by eight shots in the us open two months later , before adding wins in the 2012 us pga and both the open and us pga last year .
mcilroy is hoping to emulate the likes of jack nicklaus ( above ) by winning all four major titles
` i think it was the most important day of my career , ' he added .
` if i had n't had the whole unravelling and say i just made a couple of bogeys coming down the stretch and lost by one , i might not have learnt as much .
` but for it all to come apart how it did i learnt an awful lot .
i learnt so much about myself and my game and what i needed to do differently the next time i was in that position .
` luckily it did n't take me long to get into a position like that again where i was leading a major and we know how that one played out .
i was able to get over the line pretty comfortably . '
mcilroy 's extraordinary success last year came despite the distractions of calling off his wedding to caroline wozniacki and a legal dispute with his former management company which cost him millions of pounds when it was finally settled in february .
mcilroy 's extraordinary success last year came he called off his wedding to caroline wozniacki
and he hopes he can again use the golf course as his ` sanctuary ' from the pressure and hype surrounding augusta .
` the golf course was my sanctuary , it was where i could get away from everything and just not have to think about it for the four or five hours that i am out there and it helped .
it really did , ' he added .
` i was looking forward to getting to the course and playing and practising and i think it will be the same at augusta because there will be so much hype and build up and talk about what could happen .
` i know i wo n't be able to wait until thursday morning or afternoon and just get on the golf course and play golf .
there is only so much you can talk about it and then you have to go out and try and play . '
summary:
Here is a concise summary of the passage, covering the core pieces of information described:

Rory McIlroy, the world number one, believes it is "unthinkable" that he won't win the Masters at some point to complete the career Grand Slam. He is looking to become the sixth player to win all four major titles. McIlroy has only one top-10 finish at the Masters in six appearances, but is confident that he can win at Augusta. He cites his final-round collapse at the 2011 Masters as the most important day of his career, as it taught him valuable lessons about himself and his game. McIlroy hopes to use the golf course as his "sanctuary" from the pressure and hype surrounding the tournament, as he did last year despite distractions off the course.

summary: Rory McIlroy is aiming to win the Masters this year to complete his career grand slam. He believes that winning all four major titles is a significant achievement, as it requires success on different courses and under different conditions. McIlroy is confident in his ability to win at Augusta, despite his past struggles there, including a final-round collapse in 2011. He views that experience as a valuable learning opportunity, which helped him to win his first major title at the US Open two months later. McIlroy is looking forward to using the golf course as a sanctuary from the pressure and hype surrounding the Masters.

He considers his final-round collapse at Augusta National in 2011 as the most important day of his career. McIlroy is aiming to become the sixth player to win all four major titles. He has just one top-10 finish in six Masters appearances but is determined to win a green jacket. McIlroy sees Augusta as a course he can do well on and hopes to win multiple times. He learned a lot from his collapse in 2011 and bounced back to win his first major title two months later. McIlroy's success last year came despite personal distractions. He sees the golf course as his sanctuary and hopes to use it to escape the pressure and hype surrounding Augusta.

summary: Rory McIlroy is determined to win the Masters to complete his career grand slam, a feat achieved by only five other players. He considers his 2011 final-round collapse at Augusta National as the most pivotal day of his career, teaching him valuable lessons. Despite only one top-10 finish in six Masters appearances, McIlroy is confident he will eventually win the green jacket, viewing it as a career-long goal. He aims to use the golf course as a sanctuary from external pressures, similar to how he managed distractions during his successful 2014 season.
